DOC.brief_title: The STRENGTH Study : Shapely Sisters Targeting Realistic Exercise Nutrition Goals Through Healthy Habits
DOC.detailed_description: Stress identify major barrier engage healthy lifestyle behavior ( e.g . diet exercise ) among African American woman . African American woman consistently lose less weight Caucasian counterpart weight loss intervention . One reason disparity may due failure weight loss intervention address stress management adequately culturally competent way . The purpose study evaluate efficacy stress-focused tailored weight loss intervention compare standard weight loss intervention weight loss severely obese ( BMI > 40.0 ) African American woman . The stress-focused weight loss intervention incorporate stress management content throughout entire intervention include content culturally tailor . The standard weight loss intervention cover stress management techniques one 14 session material generic nature ( e.g . culturally tailor ) .
DOC.criteria: African American ( selfidentified ) Female BMI > 40 kg/m2 Access internet connection phone personal use Unable walk without use assistance device Failure pas Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire ( PARQ ) unable attain medical clearance doctor Substance abuse within past two year Schizophrenia Currently pregnant , pregnant within past 6 month plan become pregnant next 6 month History malignancy nonmelanoma skin cancer , remission cure surgically > 5 year Participation weight loss program past 12 month > 5 % loss body weight within past 6 month Bariatric surgery recipient Heart attack past 6 month Stroke within past 6 month NOTE : Participants `` fail '' PARQ require obtain medical clearance medical provider
